Detailed Description

Obsolete - use MultiLineEditor or LineEditor from Gui instead.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum AbstractEditBox::CaptionPos
 

Defines the position of the editors caption.

Enumerator:
CaptionOnLeft  Caption is on the left side of the edtibox input area.
CaptionOnTop  Caption is above the editbox input area.

AbstractEditBox::AbstractEditBox (  Control *  parent = 0,
WCHAR *  buffer = 0,
INT  max_text_len = 0,
const WCHAR *  caption = 0,
CaptionPos  caption_pos = CaptionOnTop,
BOOLEAN  password_mode = FALSE
) 
 

Parameters:
model Pointer to the model of the editor.
parent Pointer to the window, which embedds the editor.
buffer Pointer to the text buffer.
max_text_len Maximal length of the text to edit (Attention: include the terminal zero).
caption Pointer to the caption.
caption_pos See description of AbstractEditBox::CaptionPos.

virtual BOOLEAN AbstractEditBox::AcceptChar (  WCHAR  ch,
INT  insert_idx
)  const [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Overwrite this method to control the input of each character.

Parameters:
ch Character to be checked.
insert_idx Position of the character to be checked.
Returns:
TRUE, if character is accepted.

XYDIM AbstractEditBox::GetLineWidth (   )  const [protected]
 

Returns:
Maximal width in pixels of any line inside the editbox.

INT AbstractEditBox::GetMaxTextLength (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the maximum of allowed characters for the text-buffer. Note that the '' is not counted, hence the size of the text-buffer must be max_text_len + 1.

INT AbstractEditBox::GetNoOfFittingChars (  INT  start_index,
XYDIM  width
)  [protected]
 

Parameters:
start_index Index of first character.
width Area width in pixel.
Returns:
Numer of characters fitting into the given area.

const PagingMapEntry & AbstractEditBox::GetPagingMapEntry (  KeyCode  key_code  )  const [protected]
 

Paging means to rotate through a list of characters if a numeric key is pressed repeatedly (only in alphanumeric mode).

Parameters:
key_code Usually the currenty pressed key
Returns:
List of characters to page through for the pressed key.

Returns:
Gets the editable text.

void AbstractEditBox::Layout (  INT  line_index  )  [protected]
 

The layout of the input text will be refreshed (new word wrapping and line breaking).

Parameters:
line_index Index of line to start the new layouting. Previous lines are left unchanged.

void AbstractEditBox::MoveCursor (  INT  inc  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Parameters:
inc Number of characters to move the cursor forward (negative to move backward).

void AbstractEditBox::SetCursorMode (  BOOLEAN  paging  )  [protected]
 

Parameters:
paging TRUE, if the cursor should stay on its positon and page through the PagingMapEntry of the currently pressed key. FALSE: no paging.
See also:
GetPagingMapEntry

void AbstractEditBox::SetCursorPos (  INT  cursor_pos  ) 
 

Parameters:
cursor_pos Moves the cursor to the character with this index.

void AbstractEditBox::SetInputValid (  BOOLEAN  input_valid  )  [inline, protected]
 

Each derived editbox has to decide if the currently entered text is valid.

void AbstractEditBox::SetMaxTextLength (  INT  max_text_len  )  [inline]
 

Sets the maximum of allowed characters for the text-buffer. Note that the '' is not counted, hence the size of the text-buffer must be max_text_len + 1.

void AbstractEditBox::SetPasswordMode (  BOOLEAN  password_mode  )  [inline]
 

Parameters:
password_mode If TRUE, all input characters will be presented with '*'.

void AbstractEditBox::SetText (  const WCHAR *  text  ) 
 

Parameters:
text Pointer to the text, which will be copied into the buffer of the editor.
